alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 7:12AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Choctaw, northern Washington, west central Clarke, southeastern Wayne and northeastern Greene Counties through 800 AM CDT... At 711 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Buckatunna, or 14 miles south of Waynesboro, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chatom, Saint Stephens, Leroy, Millry, State Line, Buckatunna, Silas and Coffeeville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for southwestern Alabama...and southeastern Mississippi.
